meanings.definition: To be extremely surprised or shocked.
meanings.sent1: When I saw the magician pull a rabbit out of his hat, I was completely phreaked.
meanings.sent2: She phreaked when she found out she won the lottery.
meanings.sent3: The puppy phreaked when it saw its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected thunderstorm phreaked the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the fireworks phreaked the sleeping baby.

meanings.definition: To have one's emotions or nerves affected.
meanings.sent1: The scary movie phreaked me out so much that I couldn't sleep.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster ride phreaked her nerves before she even got on.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party phreaked her emotions in the best way possible.
meanings.sent4: The sad news phreaked his emotions, leaving him feeling down.
meanings.sent5: The touching speech phreaked everyone's emotions at the event.

meanings.definition: To have one's mind altered or disturbed.
meanings.sent1: The optical illusion phreaked my mind, making me question reality.
meanings.sent2: The strange dream phreaked her mind, leaving her puzzled all day.
meanings.sent3: The confusing riddle phreaked his mind, but he eventually solved it.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence phreaked his mind, creating an unsettling atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The mind-bending movie phreaked everyone's minds with its unexpected twist.
